# Safe Pro Group Inc. (SPAI) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Safe Pro Group Inc. (NASDAQ: SPAI) provides security and protection products in the United States, Europe, Asia, and the Pacific. The company engages in the provision and acquisition of security and protection products, operating through three segments: Safe-Pro USA, Airborne Response, and Safe Pro AI. Safe Pro Group Inc. is a mission-driven technology company delivering advanced AI-powered security and defense solutions, focused on serving customers in the defense, homeland security, humanitarian, law enforcement, and commercial markets.

The company offers explosive ordinance disposal and unexploded ordinance disposal products; ballistic vests; and body armor, helmets, and ballistic blankets, as well as aerial managed services (drones) for the inspection of radio towers and power grids. In addition, the company provides drone as a responder solutions for public safety, emergency management, security, critical infrastructure, and other incident response; critical infrastructure inspection utilizing visual and/or IR/thermal sensors; data capture, analytics, and processing by machine learning and artificial intelligence to provide data-driven insights and reporting; aerial mapping of ground-based infrastructure and other targeted assets; UAS-related training and consultation services; and other customized and specialized services. It serves critical infrastructure, insurance, public utilities, and telecommunication network operators; state and local/municipal governments and agencies; and police, fire, and other public safety organizations.

At the heart of Safe Pro's mission is its patented artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), deep learning and applied computer vision software technology. These tools are currently being used to rapidly detect small objects in drone-based video and imagery such as landmines and unexploded ordnance (UXO), enabling safer and more efficient field operations across global conflict and post-conflict zones and supporting efforts to improve the reliability of critical infrastructure.

The company was founded by Daniyel Erdberg on December 15, 2021 and is headquartered in Aventura, FL. The company was formerly known as Cybernate Corp. and changed its name to Safe Pro Group Inc. in July 2022.

## 2. Current Market Data

As of January 2026, SPAI stock is trading at $4.19, up +0.96% in after-hours trading, with a market capitalization of $87.039 million. The stock has a 52-week range of $1.47 to $9.16 with recent trading volume of 384,628 shares.

According to Robinhood, Safe Pro Group stock is priced at $5.76, giving the company a market capitalization of $118.92 million.

TradingView shows Safe Pro Group Inc. has a market capitalization of $91.76 million, which has decreased by 13.10% over the last week.

The company has 30 employees as of December 15, 2025.

The stock shows an EPS (TTM) of -$0.75 with no forward dividend yield.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

### Safe Pro AI Division
Safe Pro AI is a developer of the AI-powered ecosystem of advanced computer vision software applications and tools, highly specialized for rapidly analyzing and detecting objects of interest in drone-based imagery. Its current products, SpotlightAI and SpotlightAI OnSight, powered by the Safe Pro Object Threat Detection (SPOTD) technology, enables the autonomous identification and detection of landmines and unexploded ordnance (UXO) enabling safer, more effective force protection, operational planning and remediation efforts.

The cloud-based platform instantly processes drone imagery to detect landmines and unexploded ordnance (UXO) utilizing an extensive proprietary dataset of over 150 types of landmines and UXO including cluster munitions. SpotlightAI, leveraging the hyper-scalability of the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud, can instantly detect, label and GPS-tag mines and UXO, plotting the results on sub-centimeter-resolution maps.

### Safe-Pro USA Division
Safe-Pro USA is a manufacturer of advanced, high performance body armor and various personal protective products including vests, armor plates, helmets, complete Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) suits and anti-fragmentation blankets.

Safe-Pro USA manufactures ultra-premium, American-made ballistic protection systems including advanced body armor and ballistic plates as well as complete Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) suits, demining aprons, and bomb blankets. All products exceed U.S. and NATO standards and are designed, engineered, and produced in the U.S., supporting customers across military, humanitarian, and law enforcement sectors.

### Airborne Response Division
The drone services unit, Airborne Response, delivers critical infrastructure inspection, public safety and customized aerial data capture capabilities with machine learning and artificial intelligence processing.

Airborne Response is a leading provider of mission critical drone services using U.S. Government-compliant small uncrewed aircraft systems (sUAS) (drones). It serves enterprises in utilities & telecom and insurance with a full-range of drone-based critical infrastructure inspection and monitoring solutions as well as Drone-as-a-First Responder (DFR) services for law enforcement and public safety.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

On December 16, 2025, Safe Pro filed a patent application for AI-powered computer vision technology designed to detect small explosive threats in drone-based video and imagery. The application, titled "Object Detection Precision Enhancement Methods, Tools and Systems," outlines methods to improve detection precision and accuracy for small objects in drone-captured imagery.

The Company recently introduced InFlight, a next-generation embedded version of SpotlightAI now being integrated into Red Cat Holding's Black Widow drone currently used by the US Army. Safe Pro's new embeddable AI platform provides real-time threat detection directly on the drone, enabling faster, safer decision-making in the field.

Following real-world operations evaluation of the Company's technologies in Ukraine, Safe Pro officially expanded its product portfolio with the addition of its SPOTD NODE (Navigation, Observation and Detection Engine). The NODE was created in response to end-user demand for a solution that could enable the rapid collection and processing of drone-based imagery to identify emerging surface-level threats on the move.

On December 23, 2025, Safe Pro announced the formation of SPAI Ventures LLC, a wholly owned subsidiary established to evaluate and pursue selective strategic investments and collaborations with Ukrainian and other international technology developers. In conjunction with Ukrainian entrepreneurs, defense professionals and other local stakeholders on the ground in Ukraine, SPAI Ventures is establishing a collaborative framework aimed at accelerating the growth of the defense tech sector, fostering global innovation, and creating optimal conditions for technological advancement and sustainable development.

## 5. Growth Strategy

SPAI Ventures intends to evaluate investments in drone platforms, sensors, and software solutions developed in Ukraine and internationally that may be complementary to Safe Pro's AI and protective systems. The Company intends to market and sell, license, or otherwise commercialize integrated solutions to domestic and international customers, subject to applicable laws, regulations, and customer requirements.

Safe Pro continues to advance its effort to support the U.S. military through its collaboration with suppliers of drone technologies to the U.S. Army Short Range Reconnaissance (SSR) Program of Record to embed its AI technology. The goal of these collaborations is to enable U.S. and allied ground personnel to identify and locate more than 150 types of explosive threats including landmines, anti-personnel mines, cluster munitions, and unexploded ordnance (UXO) in real-time and seamlessly integrate the collected data into situational awareness systems utilized by the U.S. Army such as the Tactical Awareness Kit (TAK) platform.

The update follows over $20 million in new strategic investments, including a $14 million equity investment at $7 per share led by Ondas Holdings Inc., a leading provider of autonomous drone technology. The additional capital is accelerating product development and go-to-market initiatives at Safe Pro's three core subsidiaries: Safe Pro AI, Airborne Response, and Safe-Pro USA.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

### Existing Clients
Safe Pro Group's subsidiary Airborne Response has secured two new contracts from Florida power utility companies for drone-based aerial imagery services. The contracts cover both disaster response and routine infrastructure assessment services using Florida-compliant uncrewed aircraft systems (UAS).

Safe-Pro USA has received an order for its American-made Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) protective gear from a US Government Contractor operating in the Asia-Pacific region. Additionally, the Customer will test the Company's SpotlightAI Artificial Intelligence (AI)-powered drone imagery analysis ecosystem in the Pacific Rim.

### Target Markets
It is focused on serving customers in the defense, homeland security, humanitarian, law enforcement, and commercial markets.

The technology and its advanced reporting features and capabilities enables military, humanitarian, government, law enforcement and commercial organizations to more accurately, efficiently, and cost-effectively assess the situation on the ground, around their facilities or in areas of interest.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

Revenue was $101,422 versus $330,756 a year ago for Q3 2025, with nine-month revenue at $378,977 versus $1,281,399. Q3 net loss was $5,010,358, compared to $3,685,456 last year, driven by higher operating expenses and non-cash charges.

In 2024, Safe Pro Group's revenue was $2.17 million, an increase of 136.37% compared to the previous year's $917,720. Losses were -$7.43 million, 17.6% more than in 2023.

Cash rose to $7,597,009 from $1,970,719 at year-end, and total assets reached $9,695,387 against liabilities of $1,256,051. To strengthen liquidity, SPAI completed several financings: an August private placement of 2,000,000 shares with three-year warrants for gross proceeds of approximately $8.0 million; an October sale of 2,000,000 shares at $7.00 per share for gross proceeds of approximately $14.0 million; and a May issuance of Series C preferred for $1.05 million with associated warrants.

The company reported ($0.29) earnings per share for the quarter, missing the consensus estimate of ($0.11) by ($0.18). The firm had revenue of $0.10 million during the quarter.

SPAI has sufficient cash runway for 2 months based on last reported free cash flow, but has since raised additional capital. SPAI is forecast to have sufficient cash runway for 1 months based on free cash flow estimates, but has since raised additional capital.

## 8. Market Shares

The humanitarian sector represents a $1.5 billion global market for mine clearance. SPOTD's ability to reduce risk and cost for demining operations could attract NGOs and international aid organizations.

Investment Broadens Opportunities in FY26 $30 Billion U.S. Defense Drone and AI Markets.

Safe Pro is addressing a global, multi-billion-dollar need for scalable defense, public safety and demining solutions.

## 9. Comparison to Competitors

SPAI operates alongside other aerospace & defense companies including: Mobilicom Limited (MOB), ParaZero Technologies Ltd. (PRZO), AIRO Group Holdings, Inc. (AIRO), Volatus Aerospace Inc. (TAKOF), Optex Systems Holdings, Inc (OPXS), Nauticus Robotics, Inc. (KITT), and VisionWave Holdings, Inc. (VWAV).

Ondas Holdings Inc. provides private wireless data and commercial drone solutions for industrial and government sectors, enhancing connectivity and automation. Safe Pro Group delivers advanced security solutions, including AI-driven drone services, ballistic protection, and cloud-based threat detection for global safety.

With 1.78 million drone images analyzed and 31,600 threats identified, Safe Pro has demonstrated its technology's efficacy in high-stakes environments. This track record positions the company to secure contracts with the U.S. Department of Defense and other global defense agencies.

## 10. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

Safe Pro entered into definitive agreements for a $14 million strategic investment led by Ondas Holdings Inc., a leading provider of autonomous drone solutions. The closing was announced in October 2025.

Safe Pro Group has successfully raised $8M USD in a new equity financing round led by Unusual Machines and Ondas Holdings.

Ondas Holdings and Safe Pro Group completed an eight-week pilot in the Middle East combining 4M Defense aerial surveys with Safe Pro's AI image-analysis (SPOTD) to detect explosive hazards for humanitarian demining and reconstruction.

Unusual Machines will adapt SPOTD for its first-person view drones, fusing detection data with its Aura Cameras and HDO+ Goggles to deliver sharper real-time intelligence for enterprise and government users.

## 11. Recent Developments

Safe Pro Group announced that its Board authorized a share repurchase program of up to $3.0 million over the next year on December 18, 2025, funded from existing cash and/or future cash flows. The authorization allows repurchases via open-market purchases, privately negotiated transactions, investment-bank arrangements, or other permitted methods. The company said the program underscores Board confidence in Safe Pro's strategy.

On December 18, 2025, Safe Pro Group stock was trending up by 20.43%.

Safe Pro Group will present and hold one-on-one investor meetings at two virtual conferences: Northland Capital Markets Growth Conference on December 16, 2025 and the 28th Annual Needham Growth Conference on January 15–16, 2026.

The company has successfully completed ballistic testing of its '305 PRO' body armor plates under the National Institute of Justice (NIJ) certification process. This certification will demonstrate compliance with the NIJ 0101.07 standard and is expected to create additional sales opportunities with government customers.

## 12. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

### Analyst Coverage
According to 3 analysts, the average rating for SPAI stock is "Strong Buy." The 12-month stock price target is $10.0, which is an increase of 172.48% from the latest price.

Northland Securities assumed coverage with an "outperform" rating and a $13.00 price target. Litchfield Hills Research upgraded Safe Pro Group to a "strong-buy" rating and set a $8.00 target price.

### Investment Strengths
- **Proven Technology**: SPOTD platform utilizes AI and computer vision to autonomously detect small explosive threats in drone imagery—technology already validated through over 2 million real-world images analyzed from operations in Ukraine.

- **Strategic Partnerships**: Strong partnerships with Ondas Holdings and Unusual Machines provide access to complementary drone technologies and markets.

- **Multiple Revenue Streams**: Diversified across AI software, drone services, and ballistic protection products.

- **Market Opportunity**: Positioned in high-growth defense AI and drone markets valued at $30+ billion.

### Investment Risks
- **Financial Performance**: Significant net losses and declining revenue in recent quarters.
- **Cash Flow Concerns**: Limited cash runway despite recent capital raises.
- **High Volatility**: SPAI stock is 25.14% volatile and has beta coefficient of 3.85.
- **Early Stage**: Still developing commercial traction for core AI products.

### Buy Rating: 7/10

**Rationale**: Safe Pro Group presents a compelling investment opportunity in the rapidly growing defense AI and drone sectors. The company's proven SPOTD technology, validated in real-world Ukrainian operations, provides a significant competitive advantage. Strategic partnerships with industry leaders like Ondas Holdings offer clear paths to commercialization. However, current financial performance with declining revenues and substantial losses temper the outlook. The recent $20+ million in strategic investments provides necessary capital for growth execution.

### Estimated Fair Value: $8.50 - $12.00

**Base Case ($8.50)**: Assumes successful commercialization of AI products with moderate market penetration and improved financial performance by 2026.

**Bull Case ($12.00)**: Assumes accelerated adoption of SPOTD technology by U.S. military, expanded international contracts, and successful monetization across all three business units.

The investment thesis centers on Safe Pro's unique position at the intersection of AI, defense, and humanitarian applications, supported by real-world validation and strong strategic partnerships, despite current financial challenges that are typical for early-stage technology companies in high-growth markets.
tldr_summary:
Safe Pro Group Inc. (SPAI) is an AI-powered technology company delivering advanced security and defense solutions across defense, homeland security, and commercial markets, specializing in drone-based threat detection and protective equipment.

The company offers three core products: SpotlightAI (AI-powered object detection software), body armor/protective gear, and drone-based infrastructure inspection services. With proven technology validated in Ukrainian operations, SPAI has analyzed 1.78 million drone images and identified 31,600 threats. Strategic partnerships with Ondas Holdings and recent $20M investments position the company to expand in the $30B defense drone and AI markets. Key strengths include innovative AI threat detection technology and diversified revenue streams, while challenges include ongoing net losses and limited cash runway.

The AI investment rating is 7/10, with a fair value range of $8.50-$12.00, reflecting promising technology and market potential balanced against current financial uncertainties.
